clinical_study.brief_title: Necrotizing External Otitis : Study in a Regional Bone and Joint Infection Reference Center
clinical_study.official_title: Necrotizing External Otitis : Study in a Regional Bone and Joint Infection

brief_summary.textblock: The malignant external otitis is a rare disease which arises more frequently at the elderly and the diabetics patients. To our knowledge, there are few data and it is not wellc known byclinicians. Nevertheless it exposes to neurological complications potentially serious and crippling.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Outcome is measured at the end of follow-up (usually between 12 and 24 months after antibiotic therapy disruption
primary_outcome.description: description of necrotizing external otitis: patients, profile of the bacterium, medical and chirurgical treatment, rate

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Outcome is measured at the end of follow-up (usually between 12 and 24 months after antibiotic therapy disruption
secondary_outcome.description: Treatment failure is defined by local clinical and/or microbiological relapse; and/or need for additional surgery; death of septic origin. Analyse of risk factor.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Outcome is measured at the end of follow-up (usually between 12 and 24 months after antibiotic therapy disruption
secondary_outcome.description: Description of the strategies of antibiotic treatments used (double-agent therapy, monotherapy, duration)

study_pop.textblock: patients having had necrotizing external otitis and managed at the Lyon Bone and joint infection refence Center between 01/01/2006 and 31/01/2018
